abstract.text: An interface element that displays an editable text area.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Text fields gather text-based input from the user. The text field defines an area of editable text within your user interface, letting you create forms with multiple input fields.

When the user taps the text field, WatchKit displays the text input controller. Users can enter text by selecting one of the suggestions, or using dictation or Scribble. Users can also launch the Apple Continuity Keyboard, entering text from a nearby iOS device logged into the same iCloud account.

Use text fields to gather short, specific pieces of information such as the user’s name, address, password, or credit card number. Identify the type of data using the text field’s content type, which allows the system to optimize the behavior of the text input controller and the Apple Continuity Keyboard. For more information, see
You can also describe the expected content to the user in the text field’s placeholder. Effective placeholders let you build a form that is both compact and easy to use.
For general text input, consider using
or

instead. Call these methods to display the text input controller with the suggestions that you provide. Keep in mind that the system doesn’t provide the text input controller with a content type, so the system cannot optimize its behavior.

As with other WatchKit interface objects, you should not subclass or create instances of this class. Instead, add a text field to your WatchKit App’s storyboard. The system then creates the text field when it loads the storyboard.
Xcode also lets you configure the text field directly in the storyboard. The following table lists the attributes and their meaning.
Attribute
Description
Text
The initial text displayed by the text field. Specify a plain string or an attributed string. You can set this value programmatically using the
or
methods.
Placeholder

The placeholder text displayed by the text field. When the text field’s value is empty, the text field displays the placeholder, formatting it to make it clear that it’s not an actual text entry. Typing any text into the text field hides this string. You can set this value programmatically using the
or
methods.
Text Color
The color of the text. The system applies this color to the entire string. You can set this value programmatically using the
method.
Content Type
The text field’s expected content, such as a username, password, or address. You can set this value programmatically using the
method.
Secure Text Entry
A checkbox indicating whether the text field hides the text that the user entered, keeping passwords and other secure data private. You can set this value programmatically using the
method.
Enabled
A checkbox indicating whether the text field  is enabled and responds when tapped. You can configure this value programmatically using the
method.

To dynamically modify a text field at runtime, define an outlet in your interface controller and connect it to the corresponding text field in your storyboard. For example, define a property with the following syntax in your interface controller class:
During your interface controller’s initialization, WatchKit creates a new instance of the
class and assigns it to your outlet. At that point, you can use the object in your outlet to manage the text field.
To receive the text entered by the user, connect the text field in the storyboard to an action method defined in your interface controller.
WatchKit calls the action method after the user dismisses the text input controller. The
parameter contains the string entered by the user. If the user cancels the text input controller, the value is

abstract.text: Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A view that displays data from a HealthKit activity summary object.
A button that you can use to trigger a Sign in with Apple request.
A button in the user interface of your watchOS app.
Displays a modal interface for gathering text input from the user.
Displays a modal interface for gathering language-specific text input from the user.
A label that displays the current date or time.
An interface element that displays static text.
An interface element that displays a noninteractive map for the location you specify.
An object that provides information that is common to all interface objects in your watchOS app.
A button that you can use to trigger payments through Apple Pay.
An interface element that lets users select a single floating-point value from a range of values.
An interface element that toggles between an On and Off state.
An interface element that displays an editable text area.
Sets the text field’s placeholder using styled text.
Sets the styled text displayed by the text field.
Enables or disables the text field.
Sets the text field’s placeholder.
Determines whether the text field hides the text entered by the user.
Sets the text displayed by the text field.
Sets the text’s color.
Sets the text field’s semantic meaning.
A label that displays a countdown or count-up timer.
Constants that specify a text field’s semantic meaning.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
